    • Method Detail

      • doGet

        public com.google.api.client.http.HttpResponse doGet(String url)
                                              throws HttpClientRequestFailedException

        Standard HTTP GET request to the specified URL.

        NOTE: You must call HttpResponse.disconnect() after using the response. getResponseAsString(HttpResponse) and getResponseAsJson(HttpResponse) will do this for you when used.

        Parameters:
        url - The full URL to query. HttpHelpers.appendUrlParameters(String, Map) is useful to append query parameters to the URL before passing into this function.
        Throws:
        HttpClientRequestFailedException - If the GET returns any HTTP error code or the request fails due to an IOException
        See Also:
        getResponseAsString(HttpResponse), getResponseAsJson(HttpResponse)

      • doPost

        public com.google.api.client.http.HttpResponse doPost(String url,
                                                      Map<String,Object> map)
                                               throws HttpClientRequestFailedException

        Standard HTTP POST equivalent to <form> or Content-Type application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

        NOTE: You must call HttpResponse.disconnect() after using the response. getResponseAsString(HttpResponse) and getResponseAsJson(HttpResponse) will do this for you when used.

        Parameters:
        url -
        map -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        HttpClientRequestFailedException - If the POST returns any HTTP error code or the request fails due to an IOException
        See Also:
        doPost(String, HttpContent, HttpHeaders), getResponseAsString(HttpResponse), getResponseAsJson(HttpResponse)

      • doPost

        public com.google.api.client.http.HttpResponse doPost(String url,
                                                      com.google.common.net.MediaType contentType,
                                                      String postContent,
                                                      com.google.api.client.http.HttpHeaders headers)
                                               throws HttpClientRequestFailedException

        NOTE: You must call HttpResponse.disconnect() after using the response. getResponseAsString(HttpResponse) and getResponseAsJson(HttpResponse) will do this for you when used.

        Parameters:
        contentType - A standard HTTP Content-Type (e.g. "application/json"). If this is null or empty string, "text/plain" will be used
        postContent - The content to POST. Pass null or empty string to send no content
        headers - Any custom headers that need to be set. Pass null if not required
        Throws:
        HttpClientRequestFailedException - If the GET returns any HTTP error code or the request fails due to an IOException
        See Also:
        doPost(String, HttpContent, HttpHeaders), getResponseAsString(HttpResponse), getResponseAsJson(HttpResponse)

      • doPost

        public com.google.api.client.http.HttpResponse doPost(String url,
                                                      com.google.api.client.http.HttpContent content,
                                                      com.google.api.client.http.HttpHeaders headers)
                                               throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                      HttpClientRequestFailedException

        Performs a HTTP POST based on the specified content and URL. If you are unsure what content to pass, look at the other doPost methods.

        NOTE: You must call HttpResponse.disconnect() after using the response. getResponseAsString(HttpResponse) and getResponseAsJson(HttpResponse) will do this for you when used.

        Returns:
        The response from the server
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If either of the parameters are null
        HttpClientRequestFailedException - If the request fails due to underlying network errors or a bad HTTP server status (e.g. 404, 500)
        See Also:
        getResponseAsString(HttpResponse), getResponseAsJson(HttpResponse)

      • doPut

        public com.google.api.client.http.HttpResponse doPut(String url,
                                                     com.google.api.client.http.HttpContent content)
                                              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                     HttpClientRequestFailedException
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        HttpClientRequestFailedException

      • getResponseAsString

        public static String getResponseAsString(com.google.api.client.http.HttpResponse response)
        NOTE: After reading the response, HttpResponse.disconnect() will be called as required by the documentation.
        Parameters:
        response -
        Returns:
        The body of the response as a string

      • getResponseAsJson

        public static org.json.JSONObject getResponseAsJson(com.google.api.client.http.HttpResponse response)
                                             throws org.json.JSONException
        Parameters:
        response -
        Returns:
        The body of the response as a JSON object
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - If the string response does not parse into valid JSON
        See Also:
        getResponseAsString(HttpResponse)
